question: Question_03_(b)
statement:
A small mass can move along the x-axis between two large masses located
at $x = -1$ and $x = 2$. When subjected to a linear drag its position
$s(t)$ obeys the differential equation:

$\displaystyle
s''(t) = \frac{-1}{(s + 1)^2} + \frac{4}{(s - 2)^2} - s'(t), \quad  -1 < s < 2$

(b) Find the equilibrium solution of the first order system from
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH215/April_2014/Question_03_(a)}{(a)}.
